alert.note: Alert for Barry; Clinton; Eaton; Gratiot; Ingham; Ionia; Kent; Montcalm; Muskegon; Newaygo; Ottawa (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 12 at 8:41PM EDT until July 13 at 3:00AM EDT by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM EDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central Michigan, south central Michigan, southwest Michigan and west central Michigan, including the following counties, in central Michigan, Gratiot and Montcalm. In south central Michigan, Clinton, Eaton, Ingham and Ionia. In southwest Michigan, Allegan, Barry, Kent and Ottawa. In west central Michigan, Muskegon and Newaygo. * WHEN...Until 800 AM EDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 837 PM EDT, Radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain with 1 to 2 inches of rain having already fallen across Muskegon, Ottawa, Southern Newaygo, and portions of Kent County. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Reports are starting to come in of some standing water on U.S.-131 near Grand Rapids. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: Barry; Clinton; Eaton; Gratiot; Ingham; Ionia; Kent; Montcalm; Muskegon; Newaygo; Ottawa
